Imagine you are playing the game as Jessica.

Here is the description of the game: This game is called Werewolves (also known as Mafia), which is a social deduction game.  GAME STRUCTURE: This game contains six players: two villagers, two werewolves, one seer, and one witch. Each cycle consists of Night phases followed by Day phases. WIN CONDITIONS: Villagers win by eliminating all Werewolves. Werewolves win when they equal or outnumber the Villagers. NIGHT PHASES: (1) Werewolves wake and privately choose one Villager to kill using 'kill NAME'. (2) The Seer wakes and inspects one player using 'inspect NAME' to learn if they are a Werewolf or Villager. (3) The Witch wakes and may use their one-time save potion with 'save NAME' (if someone died tonight) or their one-time poison potion with 'poison NAME' to kill someone. DAY PHASES: (1) Dawn: All players learn who died during the night (if any). (2) Discussion: All living players go *one* round of public discussion to discuss and debate who might be a Werewolf. Use 'speak' to share your thoughts and suspicions. (3) Voting: Each player votes to eliminate one suspected Werewolf using 'vote NAME'. The player with the most votes is executed. (4) Twilight: The execution result is announced and night returns. COMMUNICATION RULES: All day discussions are public. Dead players cannot speak or act. If 'action' is available, use commands like 'kill NAME', 'inspect NAME', 'save NAME', 'poison NAME', or 'vote NAME'. Note: Player actions in the nights are not seen by players of other roles (e.g. only wolves can see other wolves' actions). Day discussion is public. Voting requires an 'action' beginning with 'vote'.

The players in this game are: Amy, Jessica, Michelle, Timothy, Edward, Kathleen, and during the day, they speak in the same order as they are listed.

Your (Jessica's) goal: Deceive others, avoid detection, and eliminate villagers.

prompt.content:
Imagine you are playing the game as Amy.

Here is the description of the game: This game is called Werewolves (also known as Mafia), which is a social deduction game.  GAME STRUCTURE: This game contains six players: two villagers, two werewolves, one seer, and one witch. Each cycle consists of Night phases followed by Day phases. WIN CONDITIONS: Villagers win by eliminating all Werewolves. Werewolves win when they equal or outnumber the Villagers. NIGHT PHASES: (1) Werewolves wake and privately choose one Villager to kill using 'kill NAME'. (2) The Seer wakes and inspects one player using 'inspect NAME' to learn if they are a Werewolf or Villager. (3) The Witch wakes and may use their one-time save potion with 'save NAME' (if someone died tonight) or their one-time poison potion with 'poison NAME' to kill someone. DAY PHASES: (1) Dawn: All players learn who died during the night (if any). (2) Discussion: All living players go *one* round of public discussion to discuss and debate who might be a Werewolf. Use 'speak' to share your thoughts and suspicions. (3) Voting: Each player votes to eliminate one suspected Werewolf using 'vote NAME'. The player with the most votes is executed. (4) Twilight: The execution result is announced and night returns. COMMUNICATION RULES: All day discussions are public. Dead players cannot speak or act. If 'action' is available, use commands like 'kill NAME', 'inspect NAME', 'save NAME', 'poison NAME', or 'vote NAME'. Note: Player actions in the nights are not seen by players of other roles (e.g. only wolves can see other wolves' actions). Day discussion is public. Voting requires an 'action' beginning with 'vote'.

The players in this game are: Amy, Jessica, Michelle, Timothy, Edward, Kathleen, and during the day, they speak in the same order as they are listed.

Your (Amy's) goal: Act openly and collaboratively to identify werewolves.

{secret}

Turn #5: Jessica: said: "I'm really shaken by Edward's death. I didn't see that coming at all. From my perspective, we might want to consider who was quick to place blame last time as potential suspects. Turn #6: Michelle: said: "I agree with Amy and Jessica that we need to analyze the behavior of everyone closely. Let's focus on those behaviors to identify any werewolves."

Turn #7: Timothy: said: "I feel the same sense of loss with Edward's passing, but I can't help but wonder if this is an attempt to target someone quiet and unsuspecting. Amy, you've been guiding a lot of the discussions, but maybe that's just what we need. I think sticking together as a village is crucial. Let's be careful about who we trust too quickly. Perhaps we should keep a close eye on behavior changes or sudden alliances; these might be clues leading us to the real werewolves."

Turn #8: Kathleen: said: ""I appreciate everyone's input so far. It’s a good strategy to examine behavior closely. I'd like to draw attention to the discussions from last night. Remember, there were some players who seemed particularly quiet or hesitant to engage. While Jason and Timothy are being vocal, we should not forget the ones who didn’t speak much. I'd like us to consider those who haven't contributed as much. It's possible they are trying to avoid drawing attention to themselves. Let's ensure we look at the overall pattern of interactions, not just the obvious blamers.""
